akn:section.akn:heading: Establishment of Administration for Native Americans

akn:content.akn:p: (a) Establishment There is established in the Department of Health and Human Services (referred to in this subchapter as the “Department”) the Administration for Native Americans (referred to in this subchapter as the “Administration”), which shall be headed by a Commissioner of the Administration for Native Americans (referred to in this subchapter as the “Commissioner”). The Administration shall be the agency responsible for carrying out the provisions of this subchapter.
(b) Commissioner The Commissioner shall be appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Intra-Departmental Council on Native American Affairs

akn:content.akn:p: (d) Intra-Departmental Council on Native American Affairs

(e) Staffing levels The Secretary shall assure that adequate staff and administrative support is provided to carry out the purpose of this subchapter. In determining the staffing levels of the Administration, the Secretary shall consider among other factors the unmet needs of the Native American population, the need to provide adequate oversight and technical assistance to grantees, the need to carry out the activities of the Council, the additional reporting requirements established, and the staffing levels previously maintained in support of the Administration.
